Package org.lgdcloudsim.conflicthandler

Class ConflictHandlerSimple

java.lang.Object
org.lgdcloudsim.conflicthandler.ConflictHandlerSimple
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConflictHandler, DatacenterEntity
public class ConflictHandlerSimple extends Object implements ConflictHandler
A class to represent a resource allocate selector with simple strategy. It will check in the order of the results to see if there are still resources available to allocate the instance This class implements the interface ConflictHandler.
Since:
LGDCloudSim 1.0
Author:
Anonymous

      Description copied from interface: ConflictHandler
      Select the Instances to be placed on the host. It is processing the scheduling results of intra-scheduler.

    • dealConflictInstance

      private int dealConflictInstance(List<Instance> scheduledInstances, List<Instance> successInstances, List<Instance> failedInstances, Set<UserRequest> outdatedRequests, Map<Integer,HostState> hostStatesIfScheduled, Map<Integer,HostState> allocateHostStates)
      Deal with the conflict instances.
      Parameters:
      scheduledInstances - the instances to be scheduled.
      successInstances - the instances allocated to the host successfully.
      failedInstances - the instances need to be rescheduled or be marked as failed.
      outdatedRequests - the outdated requests.
      hostStatesIfScheduled - the host states if the instances are scheduled.
      allocateHostStates - the host states if the instances are allocated.
      Returns:
      the number of conflicts when resource allocating.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
